circle_bundles.PullbackTotalSpaceResult

class circle_bundles.PullbackTotalSpaceResult(total_data, metric, bundle_map, base_dim, fiber_dim, base_weight, fiber_weight, meta=<factory>)[source]

Bases: object

Pullback total space data Z = (base | fiber) equipped with a product metric.

This object is returned by BundleResult.get_pullback_data(). It packages:

  • total_data: concatenation of base coordinates and computed fiber coordinates

  • metric: a product metric compatible with that concatenation

  • bundle_map: the underlying BundleMapResult used to build the fiber block

Parameters:

  • total_data (ndarray)

  • metric (Any)

  • bundle_map (BundleMapResult)

  • base_dim (int)

  • fiber_dim (int)

  • base_weight (float)

  • fiber_weight (float)

  • meta (PullbackMeta)

total_data

Array of shape (n_samples, base_dim + fiber_dim) equal to np.concatenate([base, fiber], axis=1).

Type:

numpy.ndarray

metric

Product metric on concatenated vectors. Typically an instance of ProductMetricConcat (or anything satisfying your Metric protocol).

Type:

Any

bundle_map

The BundleMapResult used to obtain the fiber coordinates.

Type:

circle_bundles.bundle.BundleMapResult

base_dim

Number of base columns in total_data.

Type:

int

fiber_dim

Number of fiber columns in total_data.

Type:

int

base_weight, fiber_weight

Weights used by the product metric.

meta

Provenance and options used to construct this pullback object.

Type:

circle_bundles.bundle.PullbackMeta

__init__(total_data, metric, bundle_map, base_dim, fiber_dim, base_weight, fiber_weight, meta=<factory>)
Parameters:

  • total_data (ndarray)

  • metric (Any)

  • bundle_map (BundleMapResult)

  • base_dim (int)

  • fiber_dim (int)

  • base_weight (float)

  • fiber_weight (float)

  • meta (PullbackMeta)

Return type:

None

base_proj_map(X=None)[source]

Project concatenated vectors onto their base block.

Parameters:

X (ndarray | None) – Optional array of concatenated vectors of shape (n, base_dim + fiber_dim). If omitted, projects self.total_data.

Returns:

The base block of shape (n, base_dim).

Return type:

base

to_text()[source]

Return a short human-readable summary.

Returns:

A multi-line string describing array shapes and the metric name.

Return type:

summary
